title: Understanding Emotional Indicators
text: Emotional indicators of self-harm often involve changes in mood and behavior. Consider what emotional states might lead someone to self-harm.

title: Recognizing Emotional Instability
text: Emotional instability can manifest as rapid mood swings or intense emotional reactions. Think about how this might relate to self-harm.

title: Impulsivity and Self-Harm
text: Impulsivity is a tendency to act without thinking. How might this behavior be connected to self-harm?

title: Verbal Expressions of Hopelessness
text: Expressions of hopelessness or overwhelming stress can be verbal indicators of self-harm. Consider how these expressions might be communicated.

hintAnswer: increased emotional instability, impulsivity, and verbal expressions of hopelessness or overwhelming stress
title: Identifying Emotional Indicators
text: Based on the hints provided, identify the emotional indicators of self-harm from the choices given.
choices: increased emotional instability, impulsivity, and verbal expressions of hopelessness or overwhelming stress
feelings of hopelessness, social isolation, poor adherence to treatment, high levels of impulsivity and aggression, and previous suicide attempts
